page.title: 08ERDDIG HALL,WREXHAM
page.content: Erddig Hall, on the south- western edge of Wrexham, was built by Joshua Edisbury between 1684 and 1687. It was bought by John Mellor in 1718 and on his death was passed to Simon Yorke and his descendents. The last Yorke to live there was Philip Yorke, locally known as Squire Yorke. He gave the hall, by then in a poor state of repair, and 1, 942 acres of land to the National Trust in 1973. Now restored to its former glory the hall with its walled garden stands in magnificent wooded parkland. The rooms contained a collection of mirrors, furniture, a Gainsborough painting, rare porcelain, Chinese paintings and wall coverings, tapestries and a magnificent state bed. The rooms " below stairs " are of particular interest showing the way the servants lived.
